titlestmt.titleproper: Thomas F. Bayard Vietnam War collection 1963-2007
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Thomas F. Bayard Vietnam War collection
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Thomas F. Bayard is retired and lives in Wilmington, Delaware. Bayard attended Wilmington Friends School and the East Coast Episcopalian Boarding School and is a graduate of Stanford University. He is the author of No Cats in Vietnam: The Memoir of a Straightleg Engineer. Bayard is involved with volunteer work, especially in the Peace Movement.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to the Vietnam War, assembled by Thomas F. Bayard. The majority of the collection consists of Vietnam Veterans newsletters and journals, including "Veteran" the Vietnam Veterans of American Newsletter (1980-2007), along with posters, catalogs, pamphlets, articles, letters, and other Vietnam War-related materials.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
